newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Bank of Israel to announce interest rate cut.
newsitem.headline: Bank of Israel to announce interest rate cut.

text.p: The Bank of Israel will announce an interest rate cut later on Wednesday, a central bank source said.
The source declined to reveal the size of the cut but army radio reported it could be as much as three percentage points.

The source would not say at what time the announcement would be made but usually the central bank announces interest rate changes at 4.30 p.m.(1330 GMT) or 5 p.m. (1400 GMT), after the bourse has closed.
The central bank's base rate currently stands at an annual 13.9 percent, unchanged since February.
The Bank of Israel had planned to announce next Monday its interest rate level for July.
The change in dates follows the cabinet's decision earlier on Wednesday to widen the shekel's trading bands, a move the Bank of Israel had strongly urged.
